intro: Ophiorrhiza torrentium, commonly known as the torrent orchid, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It is a small herbaceous plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often near streams or in mountainous regions. The plant has simple, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, delicate flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. Ophiorrhiza torrentium is notable for its ability to thrive in humid, tropical climates and its role in local ecosystems.
